meanings.definition: A person or company that prints books, newspapers, etc.
meanings.sent1: The printers worked hard to meet the deadline for the new book.
meanings.sent2: The printers in the publishing house use advanced technology to produce newspapers.
meanings.sent3: The printers joked that they were 'bookworms' because they handled so many books.
meanings.sent4: The printers were like wizards, magically bringing words to life on paper.
meanings.sent5: The printers' workshop buzzed with the sound of machines and the smell of ink.

meanings.definition: A machine for printing text or pictures onto paper.
meanings.sent1: The office purchased new printers to improve efficiency.
meanings.sent2: Printers are essential for creating documents in a modern office.
meanings.sent3: The printers in the office had a 'paper jam party' when they malfunctioned.
meanings.sent4: The old printer groaned and protested as it spat out the final page.
meanings.sent5: The high-speed printers whirred as they churned out copies of the report.
